members.member: summary Move the top left corner of the extent to this location
summary Move the top left corner of the extent to this location

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range._maxIsInclusive
member.summary: Boolean, true if the upper bounds includes the maximum value.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range._maximum
member.summary: The maximum value. If this is null, the upper range is unbounded.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range._minIsInclusive
member.summary: Boolean, true if the the lower bounds includes the minimum value.

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range._minimum
member.summary: The minimum value. If this is null, the lower range is unbounded.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of Range (with undefined interval)

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range.#ctor(System.Nullable{System.Double},System.Nullable{System.Double})
member.summary: Creates a new instance of Range
member.param: The other bound of the range

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range.#ctor(System.Double)
member.summary: Creates an equality type range where both the minimum and maximum are the same value and both are inclusive.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: A string expression that can be two separate numbers separated by a dash,

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range.ToString
member.summary: Expresses this range in string form. By default, ranges include the maximum, and exclude the minimum. A null value for one expression will result in a a semi-unbounded range using the greater than or less than symbols. A null expression for both values is completely unbounded and will result in a string that reads like [All Values].

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range.ToString(DotSpatial.Symbology.IntervalSnapMethod,System.Int32)
member.summary: This is a slightly more complex specification where the numeric formatting controls how the generated string will appear.
member.param: This is only used for rounding or significant figures, but controls those options
member.returns: A string equivalent of this range, but using a number format.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range.ToExpression(System.String)
member.summary: Generates a valid SQL query expression for this range, using the field string as the member being compared. The field string should already be bound in brackets, or put together as a normal composit like "[males]/[pop1990]"
member.param: The field name to build into an expression. This should already be wrapped in square brackets.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range.Contains(System.Double)
member.summary: Tests to determine if this range contains the specified double value.
member.returns: Boolean, true if the value is within the current bounds.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range.Minimum
member.summary: Gets or sets teh Minimum value. If this is null, the lower range is unbounded.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range.Maximum
member.summary: The maximum value. If this is null, the upper range is unbounded.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range.MinIsInclusive
member.summary: Boolean, true if the the lower bounds includes the minimum value.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range.MaxIsInclusive
member.summary: Boolean, true if the upper bounds includes the maximum value.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.Range.FixOrder
member.summary: If the minimum and maximum are out of order, this reverses them.

member.name: T:DotSpatial.Symbology.ElevationScenario
member.summary: Some of the more common relationships between elevation and geographic coordinates

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.ElevationScenario.ElevationCentiMeters_ProjectionDegrees
member.summary: The elevation values are in centimeters, but the geographic projection uses decimal degrees

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.ElevationScenario.ElevationCentiMeters_ProjectionMeters
member.summary: The elevation values are in centimeters, but the geographic projection uses Meters

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.ElevationScenario.ElevationCentiMeters_ProjectionFeet
member.summary: The elevation values are in centimeters, but the geographic projection uses Feet

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.ElevationScenario.ElevationFeet_ProjectionDegrees
member.summary: The elevation values are in feet, but the geographic projection uses decimal degrees

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.ElevationScenario.ElevationFeet_ProjectionMeters
member.summary: The elevation values are in feet, but the geographic projection uses meters

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.ElevationScenario.ElevationFeet_ProjectionFeet
member.summary: The elevation values are in feet, but the geographic projection uses feet

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.ElevationScenario.ElevationMeters_ProjectionDegrees
member.summary: The elevation values are in meters, but the geographic projection uses decimal degrees

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.ElevationScenario.ElevationMeters_ProjectionMeters
member.summary: The elevation values are in meters, but the geographic projection uses meters

member.name: F:DotSpatial.Symbology.ElevationScenario.ElevationMeters_ProjectionFeet
member.summary: The elevation values are in meters, but the geographic projection uses feet

member.name: E:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.ShadingChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the shading for this object has been altered.

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the ShadedRelief preset for elevation in feet and coordinates in decimal degrees

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.#ctor(DotSpatial.Symbology.ElevationScenario)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of ShadedRelief based on some more common elevation to goegraphic coordinate sysetem scenarios

member.name: M:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.GetLightDirection
member.summary: Returns a normalized vector in 3 dimensions representing the angle of the light source.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.AmbientIntensity
member.summary: Gets or sets a float specifying how strong the ambient directional light is. This should probably be about 1.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.ElevationFactor
member.summary: This is kept separate from extrusion to reduce confusion. This is a conversion factor that will convert the units of elevation into the same units that the latitude and longitude are stored in. To convert feet to decimal degrees is around a factor of .00000274

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.Extrusion
member.summary: A float value expression that modifies the "height" of the apparent shaded relief. A value of 1 should show the mountains at their true elevations, presuming the ElevationFactor is correct. A value of 0 would be totally flat, while 2 would be twice the value.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.IsUsed
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether the ShadedRelief should be used or not.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.ZenithAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the zenith angle for the light direction in degrees from 0 (at the horizon) to 90 (straight up).

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.LightDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets a double that represents the light direction in degrees clockwise from North

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.LightIntensity
member.summary: This specifies a float that should probably be around 1, which controls the light intensity.

member.name: P:DotSpatial.Symbology.ShadedRelief.HasChanged
member.summary: Gets whether or not the values have been changed on this ShadedRelief more recently than a HillShade map has been calculated from it.
